column4: can anybody help to me? i ask it because anyone who say yes get out when i tell my problem
i cant use liveCD forever
i have a ntfs disk and i need to instal kubuntu on it because it doesnt have any system yet... but i have important data there
there is no empty space
bodsda there is no empty space
Resize the partition,t hen?
how? ERROR(13): Opening '/dev/sda1' as NTFS failed: Permission denied
Using the Ubuntu installer.
installer say that only new partition creation
Does the installer really not have an option to resize it!?
yea? but if i mount it i can use my data
Don't you want to resize it, and no get at the data?
What tells you that you can't resize it?
What are you doing to get that message.
Oh, no, no, no.
Run the installer.
What does that have to do with running the installer?
But using your data won't let you resize it!
System->Administration->Partition Editor.
What does System->Administration->Partition Editor say?
System->Administration->Partition Editor isn't there?
yes i have it
That's gpartedc.
gparted
